citation.article-title: Henriciella litoralis sp. nov., isolated from a tidal flat, transfer of Maribaculum marinum Lai et al. 2009 to the genus Henriciella as Henriciella aquimarina nom. nov. and emended description of the genus Henriciella
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Henriciella litoralis sp. nov.
Henriciella litoralis (li.to.ra′lis. L. fem. adj. litoralis of or belonging to the seashore).
Cells are Gram-negative, strictly aerobic, motile rods (0.4–0.6 µm wide and 0.8–2.8 µm long) with a polar flagellum.
Colonies on MA are yellow, convex and round with entire margins.
Growth occurs at 15–40 °C (optimum, 25–30 °C), at pH 6.0–9.0 (optimum, pH 6.5–8.5) and in the presence of 1–10 % (w/v) NaCl (optimum, 2–5 %).

In the API 20NE kit, negative for nitrate reduction, indole production, glucose acidification and arginine dihydrolase activity and for assimilation of d-glucose, l-arabinose, d-mannose, maltose, d-mannitol, malic acid, potassium gluconate, N-acetylglucosamine, capric acid, adipic acid, trisodium citrate and phenylacetic acid.
Urea and gelatin are not hydrolysed.

In the API ZYM kit, alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), lipase (C14), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin and acid phosphatase activities are present and weak enzymic activities are observed for naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α-glucosidase and β-glucosidase, but β-glucuronidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, β-galactosidase, α-fucosidase, α-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase and α-mannosidase are absent.

Positive for utilization of Biolog GN2 MicroPlate system substrates dextrin, N-acetyl-d-galactosamine, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, l-arabinose, d-fructose, l-fucose, d-galactose, myo-inositol, d-mannose, methyl β-d-glucoside, raffinose, l-rhamnose, turanose, acetic acid, cis-aconitic acid, citric acid, d-galacturonic acid, d-gluconic acid, d-glucuronic acid, β-hydroxybutyric acid, γ-hydroxybutyric acid, quinic acid, d-saccharic acid, succinic acid, l-alaninamide, d- and l-alanine, l-alanyl glycine, l-aspartic acid, glycyl l-aspartic acid, glycyl l-glutamic acid, l-ornithine, l-serine, l-threonine, inosine, uridine, phenylethylamine, glycerol, dl-α-glycerol phosphate and d-glucose 6-phosphate.
Other organic substrates included in the Biolog GN2 microplate are not oxidized.
The major isoprenoid quinone is Q-10.
Contains PG, MGDG, GUDG and two unidentified glycolipids as polar lipids.
The major cellular fatty acids are C18 : 1ω7c, C16 : 0, C17 : 0 and C17 : 1ω6c.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 55.2 mol% (HPLC).
The type strain is SD10T ( = KACC 13700T = DSM 22014T), which was isolated from a tidal flat of the Taean coast in South Korea.
